alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 6:44PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, northwestern Rutherford and northeastern Williamson Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 644 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nolensville, or 12 miles east of Franklin, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Smyrna, La Vergne, Nolensville, Antioch, Walterhill and Triune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 between mile markers 58 and 74. Interstate 840 between mile markers 41 and 53, and between mile markers 57 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
